{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the most constant and valuable trait to differentiate among maxillary 1st, 2nd, and 3rd molars. Document [2] and Document [12] mention that maxillary second molars have four cusps, two buccal and two palatal. Document [5] provides information about the third molar, mentioning its morphometric features, but does not provide specific information about the ML cusp size or the position of DL or ML grooves.
